{{Infobox figure skater |name= Douglas Razzano |image= |caption= |country= [[United States]] |fullname= Douglas Razzano |birth_date= {{birth date and age|1988|10|22}} |birth_place= [[Mineola, New York]] |hometown= [[Chandler, Arizona]] |residence= [[Scottsdale, Arizona]] |height= {{height|ft=5|in=7}} |coach= [[Doug Ladret]]
Lara Ladret |formercoach= |choreographer= [[Doug Ladret]]
Grant Rorvick |formerchoreographer= |skating club= Coyotes SC of Arizona |beganskating = 1998 |retired= |combined total= 174.71 |combined date= [[2007-2008 ISU Junior Grand Prix|2007-2008 JGP Final]] |SP score= 59.02 |SP date= [[2007-2008 ISU Junior Grand Prix|2007 JGP Great Britain]] |FS score= 116.47 |FS date= [[2007-2008 ISU Junior Grand Prix|2007-2008 JGP Final]] }} '''Douglas Razzano''' (born October 22, 1988 in [[Mineola, New York]], [[USA]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[figure skater]]. He is the 2004 [[Triglav Trophy]] champion on the junior level and is a three-season competitor on the [[Junior Grand Prix]]. He placed 4th at the [[2007-2008 Junior Grand Prix|2007-2008 Junior Grand Prix Final]] after coming in as the first alternate.[http://www.isufs.org/events/jgp2007/jgpsmen.htm Junior Grand Prix of Figure Skating 2007 / 2008: Final Standings: Junior Men] ==Competitive highlights== {| class="wikitable" |- !
